purchasing power.translation[0].definiti: the amount of money that a person or group has available to spend
the amount that a unit of money can buy
The purchasing power of the local currency has halved.
purchasing power.translation[1].definiti: the ability of a person or organization to buy things, depending on the amount of money they have available
Inflation is also caused by too much purchasing power in the economy.
the amount that a unit of a particular currency buys at a particular time
The purchasing power of the dollar has declined.
